CatDescriptText: Mr. James Wilson, single, porter, 1826 Diaz Way, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "Yes. If people cannot get along.  Its more than right for them to put an end to their married life."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Wilson wearing cardigan sweater, moustache, and cap, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Thrift Drugs store in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
